fields.description:
When viewing the diffs in a large pull request, anytime I click anywhere in the screen there is a significant pause, even for operations that don't require any network activity. I've noticed this in particular in Chrome. (The pause on one Pull Request I'm trying in IE11 is probably about a second, whereas it's 3-4 seconds in Chrome.)

Example: Open a large pull request in Chrome. Scroll with the mouse roller down a ways to see that scrolling works fine. Now click in the background and try scrolling immediately. You are unable to scroll for a few seconds.
fields.summary: Pause when clicking anywhere on Pull Request page (BB-9862)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I am new to birt and i am trying to use the xls_spudsoft format available as part of the birt 4.3 to open my report as an Excel file. The reports are opened using birtviewer and there are subreports with are hyperlinks which are opened as Excel.Now I want these Excel page to be a single sheet,\\
but I am unable to get this. I have tried all the options that were suggested in the forum i.e Setting the page break interval to 0 and unchecking repeat header. I also tried adding a user property ExcelEmitter.SingleSheet and set to true. I have attached the report. Can you please help me as i have tried all options suggested already.
fields.summary: Support for Singlepage output - xls_spudsoft

fields.description:
When you create a repo you're advised to push what you have to a repo like:

ssh://git@bitbucket.org/b9chris/brass9sln.git

But once you've done so and access the repo as you will from then on, the SSH url format changes to one like:

git@bitbucket.org:b9chris/brass9sln.git

I've noticed TortoiseGit fails with the first format, but works fine with the second. Why use 2 different URL formats depending on what stage of life the repo is in? Seems simpler to canonicalize to just the main format (the second one).
fields.summary: Why do the SSH formats vary between Repo creation and after creation? (BB-9993)

fields.description: 5b8d98aa4ed34b0ca15e3087cdb63b5c

fields.description:
There are several repositories within my companies bitbucket account that use a naming scheme to denote the type of project it is.  For example, appending '-gradle' or '-cookbook' to repositories to denote that they're gradle plugins or chef cookbooks respectively.

I expected to simply enter 'cookbook' or 'gradle' into the search box on the repositories page to find all of these repositories but when I did I get no results.

These pictures describe it better than I can.
fields.summary: Repository Search Only Matches Beginning of Repo Name (BB-9841)

fields.description:
When Preview'ing an edit in the wiki or the issue tracker, the Cancel button just beside "Create issue" will throw all ones work away. This is not natural when in the Editor, since one intuitively expects this behaviour from the Cancel button (what else should it do?), but in the Preview'er, one can easily take Cancel to mean "Cancel this Preview and return to editing". Especially since the button is right next to Create issue.

This mistake has happened to myself and now also one of my colleagues.

Admittedly, this is a newbie error, but wouldn't it be good usability to present a warning to the user in this case? After all, even expert users don't write edits, previews and then directly trashes this edit all the time, so the extra confirmation shouldn't annoy anyone.

A more intrusive possible solution is to remove the Cancel button entirely when in Preview, and add another Edit button instead of it. If you really wanted to throw your work away based on its preview, you should be forced to go back to Edit for this.

Cheers
fields.summary: Adding warning when Cancel'ing a Preview

fields.description:
Please consider adding a "NeedsInfo" status for issues.

When the number of open issues increases, it can be difficult to distinguish between issues that can be worked on, and issues where the reporter still needs to provide more information. Introducing a "NeedsInfo" status for this situation would help tremendously.
fields.summary: Introduce "NeedsInfo" issue status

fields.description:
Environment:\\
Mac OSX 10.9\\
hg command-line 2.8 (installed via HomeBrew)\\
SourceTree 1.8.0.3

If I run "hg push" from the command line to an SSH URL it works fine. But when I try to run from SourceTree I get this error:

{code}
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!
remote: FATAL: You must specify http proxy server
remote: ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
FATAL: You must specify http proxy server
ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

My .hg/hgrc:

{code}
[paths]
default=ssh://home/development/hg/MyProject
{code}

I have a ~/.hgrc with a proxy setup, I have bash environment variables, so I'm not sure if that is a factor. I have tried to make SourceTree use my command-line mercurial (/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial), but still get the same error.

For now I am forced to pull/push from the command line and only use SourceTree for local operations.
fields.summary: SSH Mercurial Repositories are not working
Invalid notification when viewing my own messages (BB-9888)

fields.description:
Either give us Markdown live-preview ([issue|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3491/add-live-preview-markdown-editor-bb-3466] not even touched or assigned for past *two years*) or an [ability to edit and delete *all* the comments|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8725/an-ability-to-edit-and-delete-all-the]!

*Current implementation results in unbelievable mess and is not acceptable!*

Without Markdown live-preview, have to do a real-save (and we're ending with another auto-generated comment about edit made) *even if we change one letter in a text*. This runs into an unbelievable mess. Comments added to issues become nearly useless, because there are "lost" among sometimes hundreds of auto-generated ones!

I can't count how many issues were only partially solved by me, because I missed something important, added in a comment, because this comment was surrounded by many useless, not-editable, not-removable, auto-generated comments, added after each edit to main issue text, after changing a milestone, component, priority, kind, assignee etc.

I know and understand, that you're treating BitBucket like an orphan child (because it is free for most users) and you're focusing all your powers on JIRA. But... for God sake, *how do you want us to consider buying paid version of BitBucket, if demo (free version) lacks key, fundamental features for years*?
fields.summary: Fix mess in issues

fields.description:
Why we're limited to being able to edit / delete only our own comments? And we can't do the same on auto-generated comments?

At least give us ability to delete them or to stop them from appearing!

I can't count how many issues were only partially solved by me, because I missed something important, added in a comment, because this comment was surrounded by many useless, not-editable, not-removable, auto-generated comments, added after each edit to main issue text, after changing a milestone, component, priority, kind, assignee etc.

Let's face the facts: In current BitBucket's implementation, *auto-generated comments are completely useless* and yet you didn't give us any solution to get rid of them!
fields.summary: An ability to edit and delete ALL the comments (BB-9845)

fields.description:
I created a simple test case. See the readme for:

https://bitbucket.org/marshallpierce/bitbucket-markdown-parsing-bug

It appears that {{++}} is being transformed into {{<ins> ... </ins>}}. This is undocumented both in the official Markdown documentation and on Bitbucket's own Markdown demo page, as far as I can tell. If this is intentional, can you please document it? If not, leave my poor ++'s alone. :)
fields.summary: Markdown parsing for README handles "++" oddly

fields.description:
If a Git submodule has a pattern similar to the below, the Bitbucket UI will show a 500 error.

{code}
[submodule "something,sub"]
	path = something,sub
	url = git@bitbucket.org:testuser/something.git
{code}

This is due to the comma. The only workaround at this time is to not use a comma in a path for a submodule.
fields.summary: Git submodules with a , in the path name will cause problems displaying in the Bitbucket UI (BB-9811)

fields.description: When using "... closes BCLOUD-27; ..." in a commit message, the issue will be closed, but the page https://bitbucket.org/<user>/<repo>/commits/<id> will not contain a link to that issue due to the semicolon.
fields.summary: Issue reference not recognized by frontend
Improve Help for Hooks (BB-9858)

fields.description:
It was brought to my attention that downloading a zip snapshot results in a zipfile containing timestamps in the future for all files, regardless of when the original commit was made.  All of the timestamps appear to be UTC plus 20 minutes; so for example if I generate a zip archive at 9:14 EST, the timestamps are 13:34.

It is bad enough that there isn't a way to create the zip file with the original commit times, or to at least allow the user to set a timezone (or intuit one via the browser itself).  However, that 20 minute offset shows a truly terrifying lack of system administration best practices.  It makes the zip snapshot completely useless for anything containing a Makefile, for example.  At the very least, there should be a prominent warning.
fields.summary: Zip snapshots have wrong timestamps

fields.description: Please could Bitbucket offer the ability of pushing every new version or commit to one or more other Git repositories. fields.summary: Auto synchronize with remote Git repositories (BB-9851)

fields.description:
Hello,

It would be nice to be able to add custom tags to a pull request. Then when we view all the pull requests in the dashboard we could see which ones are related to each other. For example we might have 3 pull requests for 3 different repositories but they are all needed for the same feature. Tags would make it easier to distinguish which one corresponds to what.
fields.summary: Add custom tags to Pull Requests (BB-9840)

* Outlook 2013 (office 2013 pro)
* Windows 7 64 bit

textfieldForCode.font = [UIFont fontWithName:@"ProximaNova-Regular" size:14];\\

textFieldForConfirmPassword.font=primaryEmailIDtextField.font;\\

1.labelForAlert.font AND labelForAlertInResetPassword.font\\
2.BUttonReset.titleLabel.font AND BUttonReset.titleLabel.font\\

fields.description:
All the issue notifications from a single issue retain the same Message-ID, which causes them not to thread properly. The previous issue messages should be in the References header.

See attachment.
fields.summary: All issue notifications have the same message ID and do not thread properly

fields.description:
In text/plain notification e-mails, the actual event that took place is missing (unless it is a comment). This means that you get e-mails like the following:

{code}
#!

--- you can reply above this line ---

Issue 8344: "Something went wrong" when trying to connect accounts due to existing connection (BB-9629)
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/8344/something-went-wrong-when-trying-to

Nicolas Venegas:

--

{code}

This makes e-mail notifications pretty much useless for those of us who cannot/do not wish to read HTML email, because you have to go and see the issue to work out what happened anyway.

So far I have seen this happen with assignments and status changes.
fields.summary: Text/plain issue notification e-mails missing core information

fields.description: Would be great having an *issue kind* of: *story* we could use to group tasks, bugs and other kinds of in it.

fields.description: Could you add sorting by file names or upload date in Downloads page of a repository? Let say there are multiple versions of application binaries, it would be easier to find out the latest release if I can sort the files by upload date.

fields.description: I searched for the option to create new file online but couldn't find one. It will be great if the ability to create new source files online like the one provided by github is implemented here as well. This will be useful during the times when one starts editing online and finds that a new file has to created to accommodate the change. Right now I'm doing the new functionality as well in same file but later moving the code to its rightful new file.
fields.summary: Add support for online creating new files

fields.description:
GitHub has the ability to checkout and commit changes using an SVN client: it would be very nice to have this feature at BitBucket.  Having this feature would not only make life easier for Windows Users (and those that have to support those users), but it would also help to show that BitBucket is feature-for-feature equivalent to GitHub (if not better).

Information about this feature on GitHub: [https://github.com/blog/626-announcing-svn-support]
fields.summary: Commit/Checkout Via SVN

fields.description:
Upon changing the name of my repo and therefore its path, all previous activity has been lost.

Upon changing the name back to what it was previously, the activity reappears.
fields.summary: Changing repo name loses all past activity

fields.description:
When adding a JIRA issue identifier within a Bitbucket commit comment, the automagic link to the JIRA issue is broken. Points to localhost:8080 instead.

eg.\\
JIRA issue identifier: JIRA-001

* Commit changes with id in comment ... git commit -m "[JIRA-001] foo bar"
* Go to Bitbucket -> Commits ... to get a list of the last commits
* Find commit with id
* automagic link should be https://projectname.jira.com/browse/JIRA-001
* broken link is http://localhost:8080/browse/JIRA-001
fields.summary: Bitbucket links to JIRA issues linked to localhost:8080

fields.description:
Bitbucket supports private messages, but if you want to find any - it's no luck, because inbox contains a lot of other info - like pull request updates, new issues, comments, etc.

There is no way currently to find a private message you've received.

I believe it would be a great feature to add a simple filter here, something like a radiobutton that allows you to choose between "Everything" and "Private messages" for example.
fields.summary: Ability to view only private messages in inbox (BB-9803)

创建项目

fields.description:
It'd be great if we could "disapprove" of a pull request - as a contrast to approving.  Its not enough to not approve until its ready.  It'd be great to notify the author quickly that you don't like it.  Much like the current Approve button the reviewer could change your status to approved later after updates, or comments, etc..

Declining the entire pull request is only great if you are the author and you have changed your mind and want to modify your code.  Declining also hides the pull the request.  A disapprove button for the reviewer would _not hide_ the whole pull request - just signal the author that something needs to change.

Currently, we make a comment to show our "disapproval" (or whatever) status.  A button would be great.
fields.summary: Ability to disapprove of a pull request [Feature request] (BB-9804)

fields.description:
here I will explain my problem

I would like to create a cron to automatically update the file ZPP of zantasticox

https://bitbucket.org/andykimpe/zantasticox/src/

on my server

the problem is that the url is fixed

it always points to the same version of the file and not to the most recent version

my cron

{code}
#!bash
#!/bin/bash
cd /var/zpanel/hostdata/zadmin/public_html/zpx_hebergekimpe_fr
rm -f zantasticox.zpp
rm -f zantasticox.xml
wget https://bitbucket.org/andykimpe/zantasticox/raw/22f7936ac3fc9f36a38755eac628511dac0e0836/zantasticox.xml
wget https://bitbucket.org/andykimpe/zantasticox/raw/22f7936ac3fc9f36a38755eac628511dac0e0836/generate-zpp-file.sh
bash generate-zpp-file.sh
rm -f generate-zpp-file.sh
{code}

should therefore quickly please ensure that the raw url still points to a later version of the file

like on github

thank you
fields.summary: url raw fixe

fields.description:
I would like to request the ability for us to create issues for a specific project's repo issue tracking by simply sending an email to a specialty address, i.e. issues@my-repo.bitbucket.org - this is something quite common in many other issue tracking suites (Github included). We really shouldn't have to roll our own with the Bitbucket API :(

Our repo's are almost always websites, so specifically, we would use this in conjunction with a 'Submit an issue' link in a site's footer. We do this currently, but when I receive an issue via email I then have to manually create the issue ticket in Bitbucket.

I've heard the argument that this may open a repo's issue tracking up to spam - well, leave that up to me and make it optional or something! I would rather have the feature and sometimes remove spam issues if we ever received them. Plus, we typically use an obfuscation script on sites to hide email address from bots and such by converting the plain text email address to encoded text.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Create issues via email (BB-9790)

fields.description:
BitBucket should have an abuse report form that would allow users to report harassment, hate speech, bullying, illegal content and other violations privately. It should be possible to report users and possibly also select repositories.

Instead of creating public support tickets that are open for comments abuse repots would be only accessible to BitBucket staff who could review each case and decide an appropriate action, without.

The reasoning behind this is that reporting abuse via a public ticket makes the submitter vulnerable to retaliation from the person being reported.
fields.summary: Private Abuse Report Form (BB-9789)

fields.description:
Bitbucket's UI automatically links commits to the Bitbucket account whose email address matches that of the committer string. However, this allows for users to accidentally or deliberately use another person's address in a commit and have that commit be attributed to this person on the site.

To guard against this, add a button to the account settings to disable this functionality and instead perform automatic commit attribution only for repos that are owned by the account.

Note that this does not prevent users from using incorrect committer addresses and this name and address will still show up in the UI, but it will prevent the name from linking to the account and render the user's avatar.
fields.summary: Prevent false committer attribution (impersonation) (BB-9788)

fields.description:
I'm just going to describe the steps to reproduce as far as I can remember.

# Create a new repository
# Add a person to the repository (write access), lets call him Ivan
# Create a new team
# Add Ivan to the team
# Transfer the repository ownership to the team
# At this point in the team members management Ivan has access to the repositories because he is in the team Developers which has write access to the team repos.\\
So I decided to remove his "Direct access" permission so I don't have duplication.

Soon after that, Ivan can't push to the repository anymore, altough he should still have access right because he is in the team.

I fixed this by going to the repository page and explicitly adding the group Developers to the repo with write access.

Note: Steps 4 and 5 may have been reversed - I can't remember anymore.

Feel free to contact me if you need further details.
fields.summary: Default repository access granted to a team's groups aren't assigned when transferring repositories (BB-9787)

fields.description: As I don't think  BCLOUD-6357 will be going anywhere I have a suggestion that might be simple and go some way to solving this. At the moment clicking on the line number of a line in a side-by-side diff simply does nothing. It would be good if it were to jump to that exact line in the inline diff, meaning that when reviewing code and wishing to leave a comment in only two clicks you would be typing your comment. As it is the user must spot the line they wish to comment on in the side-by-side diff, and then exit and re-find the line in the inline diff in order to leave a comment.
fields.summary: Add functionality for side-by-side diff line numbers: jump to unified diff at that line (BB-9784)
